intro: Crematomia fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is known for its milky sap, which is toxic and serves as a defense mechanism against herbivores. Crematomia fasciculata is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
